notesStmt.note: A record in Judeo-Arabic regarding a compound in the Qatsr al-Sham quarter of Fustat, one sixth of which has been dedicated (waqf) to the two Rabbanite Synagogues of Fustat, the Babylonian and the Erets Israeli. Issued by Sa'adia ben R. Ephraim he-ḥaver; The lower half of the document is the court validation of the above, in legal Aramaic, written by a different hand. Here, in addition to Sa'adia, more witnesses are listed, Joseph ben Jacob ('Awkal?); Baqa' ha-kohen ben Mukhtar; Yeshuah ha-Levi ben Solomon; The validation is signed with the autographs of representatives of both synagogues, Sahlan ben Abraham (Babylonian, see the list of judges, Goitein: A Mediterranean Society / S.D Goitein. Berkeley : Univ Calif Press, 1967-1993, vol. 2 Appendix D, no. 6; E. Bareket: Shafrir Mitsraim / Elinoar Bareḳet. Tel Aviv : University of Tel Aviv, 1995, p. 172-188 = Fustat on the Nile, Leiden, 1999, pp. 233-255) and Ephraim (Ze'iara) ben Shemarya (Erets Israeli, Goitein, ibid., no. 4; Bareket, ibid. pp. 100-121, idem. pp. 129-160).
Condition: damaged, losses in left edge and lower left corner, faded; verso is blank.
